author: bsmarthen
title: Very Strange
review: Not Bad for 10 bucks. If you just want to use it for parts. This thing sits very high and wide. Really goofy looking. The holding cell dosent keep the Alien in if you drive it around. If you really like the mars stuff then this will be good for you. If not pass on this.

author: atperratore
title: Decent
review: this is an okay set. goes well with other mars sets, but is a bit too wide. shock absorber system is nice, but alien slides out if the trike is rolled forward. i got it to go along with the base, i think this set should be part of a larger set instaed of a set all by itself.

author: Evilnurn
title: Okay
review:
Obviously, this set is a reminisce of the 7312 T-3 Trike in the Life on Mars series.

Positives:
The set has a cool suspension system, and has a good construction, and te integration of the new orange cockpit piece is cool to go along with the alien pod in the back.

Negatives:
The pieces are dense in the middle, and the rest are basically sporadic and sparse, in the case should really cost a few dollars less. The alien does tend to fall out if one moves the set too much, and it is advertised to be "fast". The stickers irk a perfectionist like myself, but one to one's own.

Just a sidenote, my set in this case was missing one of the corrugated tubes to cover the front tire axels. While this doesn't apply to everyone, I had to order it from replacement parts, and they even sent me some of the wrong pieces when I tried to describe it.

author: Topcop999

review:

author: Legonater
title: Triple the Excitment
review:
I just got this set yesterday. It is now closer to home then calgary, and I plan to get the Astro Fighter very soon. this is my second set, and it's awesome. I like the new transparent orange peices, encpiesially the alien tube thing that I call a stasis chamber. I think the dino attack head doesn't look good with the mars mission uniform, so I traded heads with my digger. It makes much more sence to me. Its unny when I zoom the trike across the floor, cause the Martian flys right out. I hope when I get the claw tank or some other set with the chamber it will have a lid.

PROS: Transparent Orange
      Chamber
      suspension
      Awesome

CONS: Dino attack head
      chamber has no lid!

author: benners30
title: triple the fun!
review:
this is a big improvment from the first one so heres the review

pros:

good playability

author: Dannyboy94
title: Amazing set!
review:
This set is definitly worth the money I got it for 10 USD. 

Pros: cool suspension, comes with energy crystal,One Astronaut, One alien, and it was bigger than expected.




cons: Alien arms and head dont move, and alien keeps falling out.


over all I rate it a 5

author: Aleiobot
title: Mission: Awesome Trike!
review:
This is my first Mars Mission set that I got yesturday. Here is what I have to say about it.

The good - 
   1: It was bigger than I thought it would be.(About 8 and 1/2 in.long
and about 8 in. wide.)
   2: Way cool design! Has Astronaut and Alein minifigure. Two laser guns. Three big all terrain wheeels. Nice suspension. One crystal to power the vehicle. Mini pod - thing - the pilot sits in. And a containment tube to hold the Alien in on a sled. 

The bad - 
   1: The Astronaut has little space to sit in.
   2: The sled with the Alien slides out the back easily. 

   But over all: Tis is a great and awesome set!! I'm trying to collect all the Mars Mission sets! If you are too - get this set! It is also at a great price!(10.00!)

                         Bye for now!! :)

author: shima55
title: Nice starter Mars Mission set
review:
A lot is riding on this theme, as Mars Mission is a chance to revive LEGO Space. For the most part, the theme as a whole does a good job. This set is a good example of a typical set for the theme, sadly, that means it is not perfect.

Pros: 
Very nice Minifigure
Colors blend nicely
Nice tires
Hinged cockpit piece
Alien glow feature works well
Suspension works great
Alien containment tube piece is good
Decent price
Very sturdy

Cons:
Alien isn't very poseable
Stickers
Alien bed comes out if you roll the vehicle
Vehicle seems somewhat more elongated than it should be
Cockpit isn't airtight

Overall, a good set with a few small flaws. It is a nice return to regular LEGO Space, and is a nice buy, whether you are a collector or just want to see what Mars Mission is like.

author: reidak49
title: neat
review: you know when you look at it without buying you might think it will collape but it is a cool suspention can go over obsticalls with it easly the crystle is cool the cockpit is nice but breaks off easily and last flaw the alain falls out easy and the alain are poorly constucted

author: Hedgehog87
title: Awesome set!
review: I got this recently. I then got the older trike from ebay, and I compared them. I found that the older one looked a little cooler, but this one had far better suspension. Instead of rubber band, this one uses a special rubber lego piece. And it moves faster! It is great!

author: Rgijaba
title: it seems theyve replaced the T-3 trike...
review: the MT-31 trike is a cool three wheel (thus the name) all terain buggy the mars mission team uses for scouting, and travling! any hoo, this set comes with: trike driver (looks like trike driver is specs!), and an alien! theres also an alien capsule to put the alien in, but it can also store energy crysles! it took me a while to build, as i kept messing up the wheels... i plan to get an other one, its just THAT good! it also has a well-made cocpit, and some nice blue guns! over all, a good set worthe getting! there isnt much more to say... " for the last time, im not letting you out, alien!"   - trike driver

author: Gus_263
title: MT-31 Trike
review: This set is one of the mars mission sets released in 2007. Like the other mars mission sets that are vehicles of the humans, this features the white and orange color with some blue or black details. This includes a minifigure, an astronaut that is good designed, but his helmet have a no much coolcolor for it, because it looks like much the color of this trike. The set is not much good builted but features also some wheels and other useful pieces. The playability and building are not the best, so the design too, because the connections of the wheel are simple, just making it looks like simple, altough includes 95 pieces. The cockpit is in a nice position but the minifigure not stay in it very well. Altough this set includes some useful pieces, the color scheme is the same, the building is simple but the result is not the best. But the minifigure and the pieces are cool, like the playability.

review:
Buy this to add to your army, or just buy it because it's cool. No matter what, you will appreciate it all the same.

OR

author: brickule
title: Very nice for the price
review: The first thing I noticed when I opened it up was "Wow! Look at the huge tires!" Then I saw the hard to find minifig head (a light grey Balaclava), and after I finished assembling it I saw how big it is, a $10.00 set that is quit large. It comes with an Alien, a Human, and one green gem. The suspension is pretty cool, although you have to be careful not to bend the tecnic bars holding the back wheel. The Lasers are positioned in places where they can't easily aim at anything on the ground, or the air, but if it is just alien infantry you can run them over :) The container on the back, that holds the alien on a sled, is open and the sled will easily fall out but this can be fixed quickly by adding a tecnic bar on the back of it.

author: Kapoka79
title: Not Lego's best work
review:
This MM set isn't all that great for a lot of reasons.

Pros

Good stability and good suspension
Comes with cool alien minifig.
Comes with cool astronaut minifig.

Cons 

The front cockpit area usually breaks off a lot.
When it moves the tray in the back usually falls out.
The front wheels aren't that great because they always are falling off and not turning.
Stickers always suck.
The most important reason why this isn't a very good set is it is a direct cop of the T-3 Trike from the Lego series Life on Mars 8 years ago.

author: andy87
title: Awesome!
review:
This is one of my favorite sets. unlike the old trike, this one can really  drive anywhere on any terrain!

Pros: Suspension is great!
      Figures are cool!
       Can drive anywhere

Cons: Alien falls out the back
      Doesn't look as cool as the old one.(I own both)

All in all a great set!

author: vezon8764
title: Nice Trike
review:
While this has cool suspension (by use of a rubber piece that is attached to an axle), and the back wheel is a nice way to make this set a Trike, it does have some flaws. The "guns" on the top of the opening glass cockpit are completely useless, and the cockpit has to be cranked down 3 clicks for the person to sit inside. That, and the fact that, since this set has only 3 wheels, you can't really make it into an alternate model.
Pros:
Rare Astronaut (by that, I mean a rare head)
Alien and tray
Suspension
Cons:
When you zoom the Trike forward, the tray slides out of the back.
Only one crystal
Limited alternate construction
Kinda easy to build
Nobody to fight against
This set would be useful as a scout, searching the Martian terrain and capturing Martians, but not for anything else. Get it with another Mars Mission set to increase the playability.

author: rocketscience20
title: The begining of a lego collection
review:
i got this set for my birthday, and it kind of jumpstarted my lego collection.
it has an interesting and unique minifigure, and a alien containment capsule.
YEAH! the suspension is nice, and its BIG(its almost as big as my recon dropship), and its well worth its $10 price tag. this is a great set, and its too bad lego is discontinuing mars mission. But if you can find this set, i reccomend you pick it up.

this is rocketsience20, signing off

author: saber755
title: great fun, not so great army builder.
review:
as my title says, i wouldn't buy this for an army builder, but definately(if i spelled that right) for a great value set.
the trike itself is almost identical to it's 2001 counter part, but with a more modern color scheme.
in it self, the contents are a kick-butt vehicle, an alien transport tray,
an alien, an astronaught, and an energy crystal.
the extra pieces wheren't much, just a joy stick, a vizor, and a few studs of various praportions.
now for the pros and cons.

pros:

definately worth the money.
2 gold vizors, if you like that kinda stuff.
has a rubber shock, so it bounces on the carpet as you play.
the most sweet head out of all the astronaughts in mars mission.
aliens chest glows in the dark.


cons:

alien is only 2 pieces.(it doesn't bother me but some of you may want to know)
vizors paint wheres off extremely quick.
if you drive it along a tile floor it's wheels make a very loud klunking noise.
no weapon for astronaught or alien.
overall 5/5 from me, because none of the cons bother me.
hope every one who purchases this set loves it.
sencerily saber755.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Space (Mars Mission) - MT-31 Trike
review:
The MT-31 Trike (7694) is a LEGO Space (Mars Mission) set which came out in 2007. It comes with 2 minifigs and 95 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7694-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Alien: The alien is a very basic and simple minifig. The head and the arms don't move but the 2 legs can be moved. In my opinion the LEGO Space (Life On Mars) aliens were much better and looked much cooler.

Astronaut: The astronaut comes with his basic white suit with the orange markings on it. The torso is double-printed and he has a gray belt. The minifig has a white helmet with a golden visor and he is wearing a gray mask underneath his helmet.

MT-31 Trike:

The mt-31 trike is actually a remake of LEGO set 7312 from the Life On Mars theme in 2001. The Mars Mission version has lot's of white and orange pieces. The wheels are orange and the windscreen is transparent orange. The windscreen can be opened. On the top you can find two lasers and a gem. On the back you can see a container for the alien which you can put in if the alien is on his sled. The platform for the cockpit in the front does sviwel and you can see a joystick for the driver. Underneath the platform are 2 transparent blue lasers. The mt-31 trike also comes with some LEGO technic pieces but it's still very easy to build.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Very sturdy
Nice starter set

Negative:

Not so many play features
Life On Mars aliens are better than Mars Mission aliens

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Sobel
title: Good design, unfortunately not much more.
review:
After having finished my first complete series review (check them out, if you like), I have made it some sort of a good routine for myself to review some sets of my collection in my free time. And with that and my deep passion for LEGO Space, I'll go on to review this space-themed series from the late 2000's.
This trike features a nice design, but a lack of basic functions. Let's see it in detail.

Parts

With less than a hundred parts, there are quite some interesting pieces to this set. I liked the dome-like cockpit, the big wheels (keep on turning) and the storage pod for the captured alien. This set, like most of this series, comes with a lot of stickers, seven, to be precise. Personally, I think this is a lot for a set this size.

Minifigures

There are two minifigures included, an astronaut and an alien. The alien is the usual ugly green klutz, while the spaceman has a detailed spacesuit. Interestingly, the oxygen tank is also printed on his back, so no more of the classic space double-oxygen-tanks. Seems a little cheap to me, but also saves some space.

The build

The base of the vehicle is formed by some TECHNIC parts to support the storage pod in the back and the large suspension for the wheels.  I'm not sure, if this happened only to me, but one of the black cross-axles got somehow twisted, I dunno why... Well, the build is not that complicated, the instructions booklet is pretty self-explanatory.

The completed model

This trike has near to no real functions. It has a "working" suspension, which has an interesting design. The pilot sits in an awkward position on a downward facing ramp with two blue blasters. This ramp acts as cockpit with a single lever and a transparent dome not fully covering it. Behind the cockpit is an energy crystal and two forward facing blasters. In the back is a tube-like chamber for transporting the captured alien.

Overall opinion

As the title implies, this set has quite a cool look to it, but that's all. The suspension is OK, I like the simplicity in which it is created. The big wheels move freely, so the trike can be pushed forward nicely.
But the overall design has many flaws. The awkward positioning of the pilot, the lack of any real controls in the "cockpit" and the containment unit in the back that has no lock or barrier whatsoever, so the alien falls out as soon as the whole thing is tilted more than 25°. There are models in this series, that have such a mechanism. I do absolutely not comprehend, why it was left out here.
So, if you want a good-looking, planet-exploring ground vehicle for little money, this is it. Nothing less, but also nothing more.
